headline.main: RAIL HUB GIVEN UP; Red Army Yields Second Point Under Germans' Massive Attack BUT ADDS TO OTHER GAINS Advances Won in Dnieper Bend and Around Zhlobin in Face of Stiffening Resistance ONE LOSS AND SEVERAL GAINS BY RUSSIANS RAIL HUB GIVEN UP IN RUSSIAN BATTLE

lead_paragraph: LONDON, Wednesday, Dec. 1 -- The Russian Army has fallen back from the strategic rail junction of Korosten, its second important retreat before the furious German counter-attack at the Kiev bulge, but has pressed forward in White Russia and at the Dnieper bend, where almost 4,000 Germans fell in heavy fighting yesterday, Moscow announced today.
abstract: USSR forces yield Korosten; gain northwest of Gomel in Zhlobin area; advance southwest of Kremenchug; Ger attempt to retain Zhlobin described; map
